sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含事物或人的"外表，容貌"之意。
means: appearance ：普通用词，着重由总体产生的印象。
look ：普通用词，多用复数，可与appearance换用，但较口语化。
face ：侧重指容貌。
aspect ：书面用词，突出人或事物在某特定时间或地点时的外貌。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含"面对"之意。
means: face ： 口语用词，含义广，侧重有勇气、决心或自信心去面对。
confront ： 书面用词，多指勇敢、冷静地面临某种问题、困难或任务等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"遇见，会见，碰见"之意。
means: meet ： 普通用词，本义指双方或多方从不同方向或相反方向作向对运动，最终相碰(遇)。
encounter ： 通常指遇到困难或挫折，也指偶然或意外地相遇。
confront ： 不可避免的，面对面的相遇。也指敢于正视困难或问题的决心和信心。
face ： 侧重双方静止地面对面，或指指充满勇气、信心和决心正视人或事。
contact ： 多指通过书信、电话或直接会面和别人联系。口语用词。

word_mean: 面：在头的前面或腹侧面，从额到颏
任何现显的表面和外表
刀具上切屑流过的表面。

sentence.Network_en: They have maintained their optimism in the face of desolating subjugation.
sentence.Network_cn: 面对遭征服的悲惨命运，他们保持了乐观的态度。

sentence.Network_en: The cold, misty air felt wonderful on his face.
sentence.Network_cn: 雾蒙蒙，寒冷的空气使他脸上感觉很舒爽。

sentence.Network_en: He will now face a disciplinary hearing for having an affair.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因有外遇而要面临纪律听证会的裁决。

jx.jx_en_mean: with the face or surface turned towards the ground

lj.lj_ly: he lay face down on his bed.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)someone has the necessary qualities for something

lj.lj_ly: if your face didn't fit they could get rid of you within twelve months.
lj.lj_ls: 如果你不合要求，他们会在12个月内解雇你。

jx.jx_en_mean: used for emphasis or exaggeration, to refer to the existence or disappearance of someone or something
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于强调或夸张人或物的存在或消失］地球表面

lj.lj_ly: he's just disappeared &B{off the face of the earth}.
lj.lj_ls: 他从地球上消失得无影无踪。

lj.lj_ly: the most gruelling training &B{on the face of the earth}.
lj.lj_ls: 地球上最最严格的训练。

jx.jx_en_mean: with the face or surface turned upwards to view

lj.lj_ly: place the panel face up before cutting.
lj.lj_ls: 将板面朝上放，然后切割。

jx.jx_en_mean: [usu. as imperative](N. Amer. informal)stop harassing or annoying someone

phrase.cizu_name: have the face to do something

jx.jx_en_mean: directly at or against one; as one approaches
jx.jx_cn_mean: 针对某人；迎面；当某人走近时

lj.lj_ly: she slammed the door in my face.
lj.lj_ls: 她对着我砰地关上了门。

lj.lj_ly: her resolution in the face of the enemy.
her resolution in the face of the enemy.

jx.jx_en_mean: suffer a loss of respect; be humiliated

lj.lj_ly: he could step aside now without loss of face.
lj.lj_ls: 他现在可以体面地让位了。

phrase.cizu_name: make (或 pull) a face (或 faces)

jx.jx_en_mean: produce an expression on one's face that shows dislike, disgust, or some other negative emotion, or that is intended to be amusing
jx.jx_cn_mean: 耷拉着脸；板起脸；做鬼脸（或怪相）

lj.lj_ly: Anna pulled a funny face at the girl.
lj.lj_ls: 安娜朝女孩做了个滑稽的鬼脸。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)very drunk or under the influence of illegal drugs
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)醉醺醺；因吸毒而恍惚

lj.lj_ly: I had a great time going out clubbing and getting off my face.
lj.lj_ls: 我在外集会结社，喝得醉醺醺的，愉快极了。

phrase.cizu_name: put a brave (或 bold 或 good) face on something

jx.jx_en_mean: act as if something unpleasant or upsetting is not as bad as it really is
jx.jx_cn_mean: 强作欢颜，掩饰；若无其事地对待某事

lj.lj_ly: he was putting a brave face on it but she knew he was shattered.
lj.lj_ls: 虽然他强作欢颜，但她知道他伤心极了。

means.word_mean: 面对;相遇
外表;表情
面容
其他释义
表面;前面;正面
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, based on Latin facies 'form, appearance, face'

entry.def: Your face is the front part of your head from your chin to the top of your forehead, where your mouth, eyes, nose, and other features are.

example.ex: He rolled down his window and stuck his face out...
example.tran: 他摇下车窗，把头探了出去。

example.ex: A strong wind was blowing right in my face...
example.tran: 一阵劲风迎面吹来。

entry.def: If your face is happy, sad, or serious, for example, the expression on your face shows that you are happy, sad, or serious.

example.ex: He was walking around with a sad face...
example.tran: 他四处走着，神色哀伤。

example.ex: The priest frowned into the light, his face puzzled.
example.tran: 神父在亮光下皱起了眉头，一脸疑惑。

entry.tran: 崖面;山侧;(建筑物的)墙面
entry.def: The face of a cliff, mountain, or building is a vertical surface or side of it.

example.ex: ...the north face of the Eiger...
example.tran: 艾格尔山北坡

example.ex: He scrambled 200 feet up the cliff face.
example.tran: 他沿着崖面向上攀登了200英尺。

entry.def: The face of a clock or watch is the surface with the numbers or hands on it, which shows the time.

entry.tran: (地区、机构或活动领域的)外观，面貌
entry.def: If you say that the face of an area, institution, or field of activity is changing, you mean its appearance or nature is changing.

example.ex: ...the changing face of the British countryside...
example.tran: 英国乡村的日新月异

example.ex: This would change the face of Malaysian politics.
example.tran: 这将改变马来西亚的政治面貌。

entry.def: If you refer to something as the particular face of an activity, belief, or system, you mean that it is one particular aspect of it, in contrast to other aspects.

example.ex: Brothels, she insists, are the acceptable face of prostitution...
example.tran: 她坚持认为，妓院是卖淫可为人接受的一种形式。

example.ex: Who ever thought people would see Arsenal as the acceptable face of football?
example.tran: 谁会想到人们会认为足球之道可如阿森纳队呢？

entry.def: If you lose face, you do something which makes you appear weak and makes people respect or admire you less. If you do something in order to save face, you do it in order to avoid appearing weak and losing people's respect or admiration.

example.ex: England doesn't want a war but it doesn't want to lose face...
example.tran: 英格兰不想打仗，但也不想丢面子。

example.ex: To cancel the airport would mean a loss of face for the present governor...
example.tran: 撤销机场对现任州长来说将是件丢脸的事情。

entry.tran: (计划之事出乎意料地)告吹，砸锅，泡汤
entry.def: If something that you have planned blows up in your face, it goes wrong unexpectedly, with the result that you suffer.

example.ex: Can't you see this could blow up in your face?
example.tran: 你难道看不出这事会砸锅？

entry.tran: 徒劳拼命地干;徒劳无功
entry.def: If you say that someone can do something until they are blue in the face, you are emphasizing that however much they do it, it will not make any difference.

example.ex: You can criticise him until you're blue in the face, but you'll never change his personality.
example.tran: 即使你苦口婆心地批评他，也改变不了他的个性。

entry.def: If someone or something is face down, their face or front points downwards. If they are face up, their face or front points upwards.

example.ex: All the time Stephen was lying face down and unconscious in the bath tub...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬一直脸朝下趴在浴缸里，不省人事。

example.ex: Charles laid down his cards face up.
example.tran: 查尔斯将手中的牌摊了出来。

entry.def: You can use the expression 'on the face of the earth' to mean 'in the whole world', when you are emphasizing a statement that you are making or making a very exaggerated statement.

example.ex: No human being on the face of the earth could do anything worse than what he did.
example.tran: 世界上再没有人能做出比他更坏的事情来。

entry.def: If you say that something will be wiped off the face of the earth or disappear from the face of the earth, you mean that it will stop existing.

example.ex: If a nuclear war breaks out, every living thing will be wiped off the face of the Earth.
example.tran: 如果爆发核战争，地球上的所有生物都将灭绝。

entry.def: If you come face to face with someone, you meet them and can talk to them or look at them directly.

example.ex: We were strolling into the town when we came face to face with Jacques DuBois...
example.tran: 我们信步向镇子走去，迎面碰上雅克·杜波依斯。

example.ex: It was the first face-to-face meeting between the two men.
example.tran: 这是两人首次当面会晤。

entry.def: If you come face to face with a difficulty or reality, you cannot avoid it and have to deal with it.

example.ex: Eventually, he came face to face with discrimination again...
example.tran: 最终，他又一次遭遇歧视。

example.ex: I was gradually being brought face to face with the fact that I had very little success.
example.tran: 我渐渐开始面对这个事实，那就是我几乎一事无成。

entry.tran: 完全违背;与(公认的观念或规则)相冲突
entry.def: If an action or belief flies in the face of accepted ideas or rules, it seems to completely oppose or contradict them.

example.ex: ...scientific principles that seem to fly in the face of common sense...
example.tran: 似乎有悖常识的科学原理

example.ex: He said that the decision flew in the face of natural justice.
example.tran: 他说这个决定有悖天理。

entry.def: If you take a particular action or attitude in the face of a problem or difficulty, you respond to that problem or difficulty in that way.

example.ex: The Prime Minister has called for national unity in the face of the violent anti-government protests...
example.tran: 面对强烈的反政府抗议，首相呼吁全国团结一致。

example.ex: Roosevelt was defiant in the face of the bad news.
example.tran: 对这个坏消息，罗斯福毫不理会。

entry.def: If someone laughs in your face, they are openly disrespectful towards you.

example.ex: With juveniles under eighteen, there's little we can do. We can't keep them in custody. They just laugh in your face.
example.tran: 对18岁以下的青少年，我们几乎无计可施。我们不能拘留他们。他们只会公然嘲笑你。

entry.tran: 不高兴的神情;严肃的神情;板起的脸
entry.def: If you have a long face, you look very unhappy or serious.

example.ex: He came to me with a very long face.
example.tran: 他拉长了脸来找我。

entry.tran: 做鬼脸,扮鬼脸（英国英语中亦使用pull a face）
entry.def: If you make a face, you show a feeling such as dislike or disgust by putting an exaggerated expression on your face, for example by sticking out your tongue. In British English, you can also say pull a face .

example.ex: Opening the door, she made a face at the musty smell...
example.tran: 她打开门后闻到一股难闻的霉味，不禁做了个鬼脸。

example.ex: Kathryn pulled a face at Thomas behind his back.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳在托马斯身后冲他做了个鬼脸。

entry.def: You say on the face of it when you are describing how something seems when it is first considered, in order to suggest that people's opinion may change when they know or think more about the subject.

example.ex: On the face of it that seems to make sense. But the figures don't add up...
example.tran: 乍一看,似乎讲得通，但这些数字对不起来。

example.ex: It is, on the face of it, difficult to see how the West could radically change its position.
example.tran: 初看起来，很难理解西方为何会立场突变。

entry.tran: （对坏情况）显得满不在乎，做出无所谓的样子(美国英语中亦作 put on a good face)
entry.def: If you put a brave face on a bad situation or put on a brave face, you try not to show how disappointed or upset you are about the situation. In American English you can also say put on a good face.

example.ex: Friends will see you are putting on a brave face and might assume you've got over your grief...
example.tran: 朋友们看到你一脸轻松，也许会以为你已经走出悲伤。

example.ex: Scientists are putting a good face on the troubles.
example.tran: 科学家们对这些困难似乎不以为意。

entry.def: You can say that someone has set their face against something to indicate that they are opposed to it, especially when you want to suggest that they are wrong.

example.ex: This Government has set its face against putting up income tax.
example.tran: 这届政府执意反对提高所得税。

entry.tran: (不受欢迎地、不情愿地或再次)露面，到场
entry.def: If you show your face somewhere, you go there and see people, although you are not welcome, are rather unwilling to go, or have not been there for some time.

example.ex: If she shows her face again back in Massachusetts she'll find a warrant for her arrest waiting...
example.tran: 如果她重又在马萨诸塞州露面，等待她的将是一纸拘捕令。

example.ex: I felt I ought to show my face at her father's funeral.
example.tran: 我觉得我应该去参加她父亲的葬礼。

entry.def: If you manage to keep a straight face, you manage to look serious, although you want to laugh.

example.ex: What went through Tom's mind I can't imagine, but he did manage to keep a straight face...
example.tran: 不知道汤姆想到了啥，但他确实忍住没笑。

example.ex: You have to wonder how anyone could say that seriously and with a straight face.
example.tran: 你一定会惊奇怎么会有人能绷着脸、一本正经地说出那些话。

entry.def: If you say something to someone's face you say it openly in their presence.

example.ex: Her opponent called her a liar to her face.
example.tran: 她的对手当着她面说她是撒谎精。

entry.def: If a feeling is written all over your face or is written across your face, it is very obvious to other people from your expression.

example.ex: Relief and gratitude were written all over his face...
example.tran: 他一脸释然与感激。

example.ex: I could just see the pain written across her face.
example.tran: 我都可以看出他脸上写满了痛苦。

entry.def: If someone or something faces a particular thing, person, or direction, they are positioned opposite them or are looking in that direction.

example.ex: They stood facing each other...
example.tran: 他们面对面站着。

example.ex: The garden faces south.
example.tran: 花园朝南。

entry.def: If you face someone or something, you turn so that you are looking at them.

example.ex: She stood up from the table and faced him...
example.tran: 她从桌前站起来，面对着他。

example.ex: Stand up. Face the wall.
example.tran: 起立，面向墙壁。

entry.def: If you have to face a person or group, you have to stand or sit in front of them and talk to them, although it may be difficult and unpleasant.

example.ex: Christie looked relaxed and calm as he faced the press...
example.tran: 克里斯蒂面对记者，显得镇定自若。

example.ex: He was hauled in to face the judge.
example.tran: 他被带了进来，面对法官。

entry.def: If you face or are faced with something difficult or unpleasant, or if it faces you, it is going to affect you and you have to deal with it.

example.ex: Williams faces life in prison if convicted of attempted murder...
example.tran: 如被判谋杀未遂，威廉斯将面临终身监禁。

example.ex: The immense difficulties facing European businessmen in Russia were only too evident...
example.tran: 在俄罗斯的欧洲商人所面临的巨大困难是显而易见的。

entry.tran: (使)直面，接受，正视(真理或事实等)
entry.def: If you face the truth or face the facts, you accept that something is true. If you face someone with the truth or with the facts, you try to make them accept that something is true.

example.ex: Although your heart is breaking, you must face the truth that a relationship has ended...
example.tran: 虽然你伤透了心，但也必须面对现实，一段感情已结束了。

example.ex: He accused the Government of refusing to face facts about the economy...
example.tran: 他指责政府不能在经济问题上面对现实。

entry.def: If you cannot face something, you do not feel able to do it because it seems so difficult or unpleasant.

example.ex: I couldn't face the prospect of spending a Saturday night there, so I decided to press on...
example.tran: 想到周六晚上要在那儿度过我就受不了，于是我决定要抓紧。

example.ex: My children want me with them for Christmas Day, but I can't face it...
example.tran: 我的孩子们想要我跟他们一起过圣诞节，但我办不到。

entry.tran: 让我们面对现实;承认(事实)吧
entry.def: You use the expression 'let's face it' when you are stating a fact or making a comment about something which you think the person you are talking to may find unpleasant or be unwilling to admit.

example.ex: She was always attracted to younger men. But, let's face it, who is not?
example.tran: 她总是会被较年轻的男人吸引。不过，说实话，谁又不是呢？

means.word_mean: 1. the front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear;

sentences.sentence: "I wish I had seen the look on his face when he got the news"

means.word_mean: 2. the expression on a person's face;
3. the general outward appearance of something;

sentences.sentence: "the face of the city is changing"

means.word_mean: 4. the act of confronting bravely;

sentences.sentence: "he excelled in the face of danger"

means.word_mean: 5. the striking or working surface of an implement
6. a part of a person that is used to refer to a person;

sentences.sentence: "he looked out at a roomful of faces"
"when he returned to work he met many new faces"

means.word_mean: 7. a surface forming part of the outside of an object;

sentences.sentence: "he examined all sides of the crystal"
"dew dripped from the face of the leaf"

means.word_mean: 8. the part of an animal corresponding to the human face
9. the side upon which the use of a thing depends (usually the most prominent surface of an object);
10. a contorted facial expression;

sentences.sentence: "she made a grimace at the prospect"

means.word_mean: 11. a specific size and style of type within a type family
12. status in the eyes of others;
13. impudent aggressiveness;

sentences.sentence: "he had the effrontery to question my honesty"

means.word_mean: 14. a vertical surface of a building or cliff
1. deal with (something unpleasant) head on;

sentences.sentence: "He faced the terrible consequences of his mistakes"

means.word_mean: 2. oppose, as in hostility or a competition;

sentences.sentence: "Jackson faced Smith in the boxing ring"
"The two enemies finally confronted each other"

means.word_mean: 3. be oriented in a certain direction, often with respect to another reference point; be opposite to;
4. be opposite;
5. turn so as to face; turn the face in a certain direction;
6. present somebody with something, usually to accuse or criticize;

sentences.sentence: "He was faced with all the evidence and could no longer deny his actions"

means.word_mean: 7. turn so as to expose the face;
8. line the edge (of a garment) with a different material;
9. cover the front or surface of;

sentences.sentence: "The building was faced with beautiful stones"

list.explanation: 毫无突出特点的人或物，平庸之辈

example.en: He had a time convincing them he was a genuine expert, not just another pretty face.
example.zh: 他曾一度使他们相信，他是一位真正的专家，而不是平庸之辈。

auth_sentence.content: But they also face another problem - local hunters.
auth_sentence.res_content: But they also face another problem - local hunters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But they also face another problem - local hunters.

auth_sentence.content: This is the cliff face of proving a concept.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is the cliff face of proving a concept.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is the cliff face of proving a concept.

auth_sentence.content: They will now face reigning Olympic champions United States.
auth_sentence.res_content: They will now face reigning Olympic champions United States.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They will now face reigning Olympic champions United States.

stems_affixes.word_buile: facet[n.[问题等的]侧面,一面;[多面体的]面]+ious……的→做事表面化→轻浮的
in不+efface[v.擦掉,抹去]+able可以……的→adj.抹不掉的,不能消除的
efface[v.擦掉,抹去]+ment表名词→n.抹消, 抹杀
face脸,面→n.脸,面貌;表情;正面 v.面对着;朝,面向

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分界面, 接触面,界面
stems_affixes.word_buile: inter在……之间+face脸,面→n.分界面, 接触面,界面

stems_affixes.value_cn: 损伤外观, 丑化, 使失面子

stems_affixes.word_buile: face脸,面→n.脸,面貌;表情;正面 v.面对着;朝,面向

Sentence.sentence: Some scientistsmaintain that the changes we are seeing fall within the range of random (无规律的) variation—some years are cold, others warm, and we have just had an unremarkable string of warm yearsrecently—but that is becoming an increasingly rare interpretation in the face of continued and increasing warm conditions.
He bought an alarm clock with a pig face.
Even if they know what the company is up to, they still have no idea what they're paying for Face book because people don't really know what their personal data is worth.

means.word_mean: 面容, 面部表情

sentences.en: Their faces were pinched with grief.
sentences.cn: 他们的面容因悲伤而憔悴。

sentences.en: The children's faces were brightened up when they saw their parents appear at the gate of the kindergarten.
sentences.cn: 当孩子们看到家长们出现在幼儿园门口时, 都喜形于色。

means.word_mean: 表面, 正面
面对, 面向…

sentences.en: All the houses there face south.
She sat on Mother's right, facing Mary.
sentences.cn: 她坐到妈妈右边, 脸朝着玛丽。

sentences.en: He feels nervous when he faces so many people.
sentences.cn: 面对那么多人, 他感到紧张。

means.word_mean: 正视; 承认

sentences.en: He was prepared to face the consequences.

means.word_mean: 面临…

sentences.en: He faced being isolated from society.
sentences.cn: 他面临被社会抛弃的危险。

jushi.english: His face beamed with delight when he heard that the first prize was to give to him.
jushi.chinese: 他听到头等奖给他时面露喜色。

jushi.english: The face of the building is covered with climbing plants.
jushi.chinese: 建筑物的正面被攀缘植物所覆盖。

jushi.english: The blood drained from her face as she learned what had happened.
jushi.chinese: 当她得知所发生的一切时,脸色煞白。
